result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Increased Penalty for Elder Person Victim

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Esqueda

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Calendar call on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:08 PM Defendant Ricardo Esqueda in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Ricardo Esqueda. Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases: 2022CF000034, 2022CF000156, 2022CF000193, 2022CF000447, 2022CT000053
Atty Renc informs the court the reason for missing court.
ADA Pfeil states these cases assigned to an out-of-county judge.
BY THE COURT: Warrants are quashed and bonds reinstated.
Calendar call scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8:40 AM Defendant Ricardo Esqueda not in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Ricardo Esqueda.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 2022CF000018, 2022CF000034, 2022CF000156, 2022CF000193, 2022CF000447, and 2022CT000053.
Court questions Atty Renc as to where her client is today.
State requests warrants.
BY THE COURT:  Warrants with a total of $2,500 cash alternative.
Request for Plea/Sentencing Hearing be set for 10/07/22 in Marathon County Courthouse Branch 3
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
/s/LJM 6-22-2022 - Approved - Judge Jacobson.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:59 PM . Defendant Ricardo Esqueda in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Ricardo Esqueda.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CF18 and 22CF34.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ricardo Esqueda appeared in court, Attorney Anne Renc for Ricardo Esqueda appeared in court. 
Both files heard: 22CF34 & 22CF18

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
No contact with J.T.

01:48 PM Defendant Ricardo Esqueda in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is informed of his right to have an attorney and the right to a trial.
Defendant stated that he did apply for a public defender today and has been determined to be eligible and he is waiting for an appointment of an attorney.
Defendant needed to provide a termination letter from his employer to the public defender's office to get counsel appointed.
Defendant wishes to adjourn.
State does not object to the adjournment.
State would request a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 14, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2
